files.patch:
@@ -3,1 +3,1 @@
- * Copyright (c) 2012, 2024 SAP SE. All rights reserved.
+ * Copyright (c) 2012, 2025 SAP SE. All rights reserved.
@@ -198,0 +198,9 @@
+  if (sender_pc() == nullptr) {
+    // Likely the return pc was not yet stored to stack.  We rather discard this
+    // sample also because we would hit an assertion in frame::setup().  We can
+    // find any other random value if the return pc was not yet stored to
+    // stack. We rely on consistency checks to handle this (see
+    // e.g. find_initial_Java_frame())
+    return false;
+  }
+

@@ -3,1 +3,1 @@
- * Copyright (c) 2012, 2025 SAP SE. All rights reserved.
+ * Copyright (c) 2012, 2024 SAP SE. All rights reserved.
@@ -69,7 +69,1 @@
-    if (!CodeCache::contains(pc)) {
-      // The thread `isInJava` but its pc is not in the CodeCache. This is uncommon. It
-      // can occur, for instance, if we're trying to sample the stack while actually
-      // handling a SIGTRAP (e.g. because of a range check). It is not safe to do that.
-      return false;
-    }
-
+    // pc could refer to a native address outside the code cache even though the thread isInJava.

@@ -3,1 +3,1 @@
- * Copyright (c) 2012, 2025 SAP SE. All rights reserved.
+ * Copyright (c) 2012, 2024 SAP SE. All rights reserved.
@@ -68,7 +68,1 @@
-    if (!CodeCache::contains(pc)) {
-      // The thread `isInJava` but its pc is not in the CodeCache. This is uncommon. It
-      // can occur, for instance, if we're trying to sample the stack while actually
-      // handling a SIGTRAP (e.g. because of a range check). It is not safe to do that.
-      return false;
-    }
-
+    // pc could refer to a native address outside the code cache even though the thread isInJava.
